chapter.title: The automation window

caption.para: The automation window screenshot showing drum

chapter.para: The automation window is accessed by edit menu item automation. There are basic edit tools available to do your automation. You can use keyboard bindings to do your tasks are select appropriate edit tool of toolbar. As the appropriate port is checked it enables the automation of it. Else it is by-passed and won't see any automation data. By enabling a port it gets visible within the editor.

listitem.para: Position cursor. Use arrow keys. Page-Up and Page-Down switches the automation area.
Add automation point applied horizontally by time and vertically as value. Add by enter space.
Delete automation point. Use delete key.
Select automation. Alternatively do select all, note selects everything visible within scope tab.

chapter.para: Adjust zoom by combo-box and add/remove automation area to editor by combo-box selection.

sect2.title: Editing tools
sect2.para: The tools menu button contains items that opens dialogs to do common editing tasks. Like move, crop or select accelerations.

sect2.title: Select accelerations
sect2.para: The select acceleration dialog allows you to select accelerations of given position and selected controls.

row.entry: Check button to say if you would like to copy selection to clipboard.
Add/remove controls to enable/disable for selecting automation area.
Set the x0 offset of region to select.
Set the x1 offset of region to select.

sect2.title: Ramp accelerations
sect2.para: The ramp acceleration dialog allows you to ramp accelerations to a specified value using given number of steps.

row.entry: The x0-offset to start ramp from.
The y0-value to use as first value.
The x1-offset to stop ramp to.
The y1-value to use as last value.
The number of steps to use to ramp value y0 to y1 from offset x0 to x1.
